nodes.title: ChatGPT
nodes.desc: A conversational AI model developed by OpenAI, designed to engage in natural-sounding conversations and answer a wide range of questions. [More Info](https://openai.com/blog/chatgpt/)

nodes.title: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
nodes.desc: A subfield of artificial intelligence that deals with the interaction between computers and humans in natural language. [More Info](https://www.nltk.org/book/)

nodes.title: Dialogue Systems
nodes.desc: Computer systems that can engage in conversation with humans, either using text or speech. [More Info](https://www.dialogflow.com/)

nodes.title: Speech Recognition
nodes.desc: The process of automatically recognizing spoken words and converting them into text. [More Info](https://www.speechmatics.com/)

nodes.title: Computer Vision
nodes.desc: A field of AI that deals with the interpretation and understanding of visual data from images and videos. [More Info](https://www.computervision.org/)

nodes.title: Robotics
nodes.desc: The design, construction, and operation of robots, which can be controlled by AI systems. [More Info](https://www.robotics.org/)

nodes.title: Human-Computer Interaction (HCI)
nodes.desc: The study of how humans interact with computers and other electronic devices. [More Info](https://www.hcibib.org/)

nodes.title: Cognitive Science
nodes.desc: The interdisciplinary study of the human mind and its processes, including perception, attention, memory, and decision-making. [More Info](https://www.cognitivescience.org/)

nodes.title: Philosophy of AI
nodes.desc: The branch of philosophy that deals with the fundamental questions and concerns surrounding AI. [More Info](https://plato.stanford.edu/entries/artificial-intelligence/)

nodes.title: Ethics of AI
nodes.desc: The study of the moral and social implications of AI systems. [More Info](https://www.aiethicslab.com/)

nodes.title: Artificial Intelligence (AI)
nodes.desc: The development of computer systems that can perform tasks that typically require human intelligence, such as visual perception, speech recognition, and decision-making. [More Info](https://www.ai.mit.edu/)

nodes.title: Machine Learning (ML)
nodes.desc: A subset of AI that involves the development of algorithms and statistical models that enable machines to perform tasks without being explicitly programmed. [More Info](https://www.ml.cmu.edu/)

nodes.title: Deep Learning (DL)
nodes.desc: A type of ML that involves the use of neural networks with multiple layers to analyze data. [More Info](https://www.deeplearningbook.org/)

nodes.title: Neural Networks
nodes.desc: A series of algorithms that seek to recognize underlying relationships in a set of data through a process that mimics the way the human brain operates. [More Info](https://www.tensorflow.org/tutorials/keras/basic_classification)

nodes.title: Transformers
nodes.desc: A type of neural network architecture that is particularly well-suited to NLP tasks. [More Info](https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.03762)

nodes.title: Language Models
nodes.desc: Statistical models that predict the next word in a sequence of words, given the context of the previous words. [More Info](https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/W18-3001/)

nodes.title: Text Generation
nodes.desc: The process of generating human-like text using AI models. [More Info](https://www.textgenrnn.com/)

nodes.title: Conversational AI
nodes.desc: AI systems that are designed to engage in natural-sounding conversations with humans. [More Info](https://www.conversica.com/)
